Hence it is that the air, rushing from every quarter, is borne with rapid motion to that place where the pressure ol the air is diminished. But these atirial torrents rushing from opposite points produce, in their passage, a sudden and impetuous wind, and when at last they meet and dash against each other they are bent in all directions and driven round in a circle, since the air rushes from all directions and allows no outlet for their escape; and this seems to be the cause of the violent whirlwinds which suddenly arise.
